newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian cattlemen call for corporate body.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian cattlemen call for corporate body.

text.p: Australia's Cattlemen's Union (CU) issued a statement on Friday calling on the federal government to replace all three industry statutory authorities, the Australian Meat and Livestock Corp (AMLC), the Meat Research Corp (MRC) and the Meat Industry Council (MIC).
CU president John Purcell said the industry body should be a corporate model and not a statutory authority.
It should be funded, however, by the statutory cattle transaction levy, he said.
CU's position on the current review process into the AMLC, MRC and MIC came after extensive consultation with cattle producers, Purcell said.
